article.title: PassGAN: A Deep Learning Approach for Password Guessing

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the shortcut connection in a Residual Block as used in PassGAN?
choices: To apply a gradient penalty to the discriminator
To generate a random noise vector as input
To limit the maximum length of generated passwords
To mitigate training error increase with increasing layers

multiple_choice_question.text: In PassGAN's architecture, what is the role of the discriminator (D)?
choices: To generate password guesses from a normal distribution
To leak information about the training data to the generator
To determine the model dimensionality for each layer
To specify the number of iterations for the training process

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 3 indicate about the relationship between the number of iterations and PassGAN\'s performance on the RockYou testing set?
choices: The optimal number of iterations is independent of the dataset.
Overfitting occurs as the number of iterations becomes too large.
PassGAN requires a significantly larger number of iterations compared to rule-based methods.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 4 suggest about PassGAN\'s ability to model password probabilities compared to FLA?
choices: PassGAN consistently assigns more accurate probabilities than FLA for all passwords.
Both models struggle to accurately predict the probabilities of low-frequency passwords.
PassGAN can model some low-probability (according to FLA) passwords effectively.
FLA is more successful at capturing the Markovian structure of password generation.
